alert.note: Alert for Juniata; Northumberland; Perry; Snyder; Union (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL NORTHUMBERLAND... NORTHEASTERN JUNIATA...SNYDER...SOUTHEASTERN UNION AND NORTHEASTERN PERRY COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 623 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles southwest of Selinsgrove, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Sunbury, Milton, Lewisburg, Selinsgrove, Northumberland, Mifflinburg, Winfield, Shamokin Dam, Linntown, Hummels Wharf, Middleburg, Montandon, Kreamer, Port Trevorton, Penns Creek, Richfield, Mount Pleasant Mills, Kratzerville, Paxtonville and Vicksburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central and south central Pennsylvania.
